subject: meta-bletchley: Add init service to setup system
commitMessage:
meta-bletchley: Add init service to setup system

To setup GPIOs and set fan speed to 70%

Signed-off-by: Howard Chiu <howard.chiu@quantatw.com>
Signed-off-by: Potin Lai <potin.lai@quantatw.com>
Change-Id: I7a64e19b6e34bcab7013b382d19d7be6156bf87a

Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

Since we used '-e' in the #! but not 'set -e', I worry that running indirectly via bash will skip the '-e' option...  Can you look into this?  Probably as simple as running directly rather than via bash in the service file.

Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> Since we used '-e' in the #! but not 'set -e', I worry that running indirectly via bash will skip the '-e' option...  Can you look into this?  Probably as simple as running directly rather than via bash in the service file.

I tested before, if set_gpio or set_fan return 1, the script exit immediately.

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 0eb09a13b1e395c0ff09d794cc11bd1513a6b935 by Patrick Williams

Patch Set 10:

Build Successful 

IBM Hardware CI : witherspoon hardware tests passed
I'd like to avoid shell scripts like this, but this is fine in the early Hack phase of the project.  I opened https://github.com/facebookexternal/openbmc.quanta/issues/2763 to track deprecating this.
Can we be more descriptive on this?
How do you know that this script isn't started after any services that depend on it?  Maybe the fan control is already started at this point?  Do we need to add this to an earlier startup service?

So far we just want to set init values when bootup, we haven't add any fan control service yet.
Is it ok we add dependency in new service? ex: add After=sys-init.service in new service.

I suspect we'll end up modifying the sys-init.service instead.  Adding a "WantedBy" and "Before" clause for things like phosphor-pid-control.  We should try to avoid modifying upstream service files themselves.

I have rename service to 'bletchley-sys-init' at patchset 9
will also add 'Before=phosphor-pid-control.service' in next patchset
If you add a Before you likely also need a WantedBy.

Please drop .sh name on shell scripts and use kebab-case.

Maybe `bletchley-early-sys-init` ?
I don't think this DEPEND is necessary when we already have 'inherit systemd'.
What in the script relies on libsystemd?  I'm surprised we have this listed as an RDEPEND.

See https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/anti-patterns.md#incorrect-placement-of-executables-in-sbin-usrsbin-or-bin-usrbin .

This probably belongs in libexec.
I'm slightly confused why we need this?  Doesn't the #! run it under bash to begin with?  Did we miss the 'chmod 755' on the file?
